questionListItems.title: What time does school start and end for Secondary 1 students?

answer.body:
Day

Start Time

End Time

Monday-Thursday

7.20am

2.20pm

Friday

9.20am

12.25pm

Odd Fridays - Term 1-3: Home Based Learning Days


After CCAs have been allocated, students will have CCAs after dismissal on

Mondays, Tuesdays and/or Thursdays. There will be a 10-min snack break on

every weekday except Fridays. Students should bring their own food for snack

break.

questionListItems.title: How do we know which class our child / ward is allocated in 2024?

answer.body:
Your child’s / ward’s class allocation will be reflected on PG App by 1st January 2024.


Once you are in the App, please click the ‘Contacts’ tab at the bottom, and you will be directed to your child’s name, school and class (image reference).


Alternatively, students can also view their class allocation from the noticeboard

placed outside the school general office on the first day of school.

questionListItems.title:
How long can my child continue to use the Primary School Smart Card
(SSC) for concessionary travel?

answer.body:
Your child can continue to use his Primary School SSC for concessionary

travel till his new card is issued. The new Secondary Level SSC will usually be

issued in April 2024. Secondary 1 students will be informed when the SSC are

dispatched to our school.

questionListItems.title: My child is in Secondary 1, when can I get the timetable for Term 1 2024?

answer.body: There will be no formal lessons during the 1st week of January as students will be involved in the orientation. Timetable will be made available on the school website (Parent-Child Toolkit) at the end of the 1st week and more details will be shared by Form Teachers.

questionListItems.title: Tell us about the school attire, socks and shoes.

answer.body:
● Boys: White school shirt and blue shorts.


● Girls: Blue sailor moon attire (for Lower Sec) and school blouse and blue

skirt (for Upper Sec).


● White socks and covered shoes (of any type and colour)


To view our school attire please check out our supplier Jeep Sing Fashion here.

questionListItems.title: When can my child select his Co-Curricular Activity (CCA)?

answer.body: CCA selections are usually held later January to early February 2024. More information will be shared during the PTM on 4 January 2024.

questionListItems.title: From 2024, all schools will embark on Full Subject Based Banding (FSBB). How can we have more details on this?

answer.body:
Full Subject-Based Banding (FSBB) is part of MOE’s ongoing efforts to nurture the joy of learning and develop multiple pathways to cater to the different strengths and interests of our students.


For more information on FSBB:


o Offering subjects at a more demanding level

o Full SBB interactive webpage


This will be covered more during our Parent Teacher Meeting (PTM) on 4

January 2024. Please refer to the Sec 1 e-Registration Package for details.

questionListItems.title: Who should we approach for queries related to Subject Based Banding (SBB), Mother Tongue language (MTL) and MOE FAS?

answer.body:
Students who have been offered SBB subject(s) at a More Demanding Level or Higher Mother Tongue Language (HMTL) will be notified via PG, email or call.


● For SBB matters, please email Mr Flavian at

flavian_brian_fernandez@moe.edu.sg.


● For MTL matters, please email Ms Chong Sze Khuin at

chong_sze_khuin@moe.edu.sg.


● For MOE FAS, please access this link for application details

https://go.gov.sg/parentsupportwithwgs

questionListItems.title: What is the reporting time for Sec 1 students on 2 Jan 2024 and can we accompany him/her?

answer.body:
Reporting time: By 7.20am.

Gate A (Main entrance) opens at 6.30am

Parents can drive in and drop off the students in front of the school general office foyer.

Gate B opens at 6.45am (only on rainy mornings)

Gate C opens at 6.45am


Refer to floorplan of school for details.



Parents are not allowed to accompany students beyond the school general office foyer on the first day of school. This is to assist the student to his/her new school and routines. Please be rest assured that our team of teachers will be with him/her.

questionListItems.title: If there is not enough stock for our child’s/ward’s school attire, what should we do?

answer.body: There may be a delay in stocking back certain sizes due to higher demand. Thus, your child/ward can wear his/her primary school attire for the first week of January 2024.

questionListItems.title: Where can we buy the Secondary 1 school attire, textbooks and stationery?

answer.body: Please click here to purchase them online for home delivery or check the dates available for onsite purchases in school.

questionListItems.title:
My child is posted to Woodgrove Secondary School, but we would like to transfer him/her to
another school, how do we do that?

answer.body:
You can approach the transfer school of your choice for more clarifications on the process or refer to this link for more details.


Please note that appeals to transfer to any schools are subject to meeting the school’s indicative PSLE score ranges and availability of vacancies.


If your child is posted to Woodgrove Secondary School but you have submitted appeals to other schools for transfer out, please continue to complete the e-Registration with WGS via this form, pending the outcome of the appeals.


Your child should continue to attend his/her posted secondary school until the transfer to another school is approved.

questionListItems.title: My child is posted to Woodgrove Secondary School, how do we register him/her?

answer.body: On the day of the Sec 1 Registration as indicated on the school posting letter, please check out our school website here for the e-Registration details.

questionListItems.title: What does Woodgrove offer in terms of subjects, electives, programmes & DSA areas?

answer.body: You can get more details from the MOE website under School Finder via this link.

questionListItems.title: What is Woodgrove’s 2022 PSLE cut-off point for G1, G2 & G3?

answer.body: Please refer to MOE's platform: School Finder.
